body.p: Dan Armak, our KDE developer writes: "After a long, long wait, KDE 3.1 has finally been released. Ebuilds are available in portage. emerge rsync and emerge kde to get it.

In Gentoo, KDE 3.1 lives side-by-side with KDE 3.0.x (and with KDE cvs from my cvs ebuilds). It will not replace your 3.0.x installation; you will be able to choose which one to start from the kdm/gdm/xdm session list. So remember to unmerge the old KDE 3.0.x if you want to reclaim diskspace after you make your transition.
The ebuilds have x86 and ppc stable keywords.
The KDE.org announcement is here, and a nice new-features guide is here. A more complete list of new features is here.
Enjoy KDE 3.1, and thanks to all the great KDE developers who've worked hard on this release!"
